characters: SCREAMING FANS, FANATICAL SUPPORTERS, PEOPLE CRYING, WOME
ONE PEOPLE, ONE EMPIRE, ONE LEADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A brown shirt buttoned. - Badges pinned. - Belt tightened. - Neck kerchief tied. = Socks pulled up. - Hair combed. Shoes clicked together at the heels, one foot stomps down hard on the floor. He is dressed. We PULL to a CLOSE-UP, coming face to face with our HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANNES BETZLER, (JOJO), a cute 10 year-old boy. The room is covered with NAZI POSTERS and other PARAPHERNALIA, including pictures of ADOLF HITLER. You guessed it, he’s a little Nazi. Jojo stares into a full-length mirror and takes a deep breath. gogo Jojo Betzler. Ten years old. And today you join the ranks of the Jungvolk in a very special training weekend. It’s going to be intense. But today you become a man. (deep breath, nervous) I swear to devote all my energies and my strength to the savior of our country, Adolf Hitler. I am willing and ready to give up my life for him, so help me God. A STRANGE FIGURE passes behind him, an ADULT, dressed in NAZI UNIFORM. It feels ghostly and fantastical. We'll fin out who this guy is very soon.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah man, that’s right. (beat) Now, Jojo Betzler, what is your mind? gogo A snake mind.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And Jojo Betzler, what is your body? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gogo A wolf body.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And Jojo Betzler, what is your courage?

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Panther courage.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And Jojo Betzler, what is your soul?

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: A German soul.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yeah man, you're ready. gogo Adolf, I don’t think I can do this. The stranger leans into shot, revealing it’s none other t Jojo's IMAGINARY FRIEND, ADOLF HITLER. However, it’s not Hitler we're all used to, he’s imaginary and therefore ca only know what Jojo knows. He’s more of a charming buffoo who floats through life with carefree, whimsical abandon.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: What?! Of course you can. Sure you're a bit scrawny, unpopular, and still can’t tie your shoelaces without adult supervision, but you're also the bestest, most loyal little Nazi I've ever met. Not to mention you're incredibly handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo smiles. Feeling better.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you're gonna go out there and have a great time, ok?

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Ok, that’s the spirit! Now, Heil me man. gogo Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Come on, you can do better than that. Heil Hitler! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jogo Heil Hitler!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Just throw it away. Don’t even think about it. Jogo Heil Hitler!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: No, you're over thinking it. Heil Hitler. Jogo Heil Hitler!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Heil HITLER. They start jogging on the spot. gogo Heil HITLER!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Ooh, that’s it. gogo

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Yay, now you've got it! Jogo Heil Hitler! Heil Hitler! Heil Hitle: Heil Hitler! Heil Hitler! Heil Hitle

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Ooh, have a great day! You're going to be the best. You can do it! Jojo and Adolf scream like war pigs and Jojo sprints out door.

dialogues.speaker: HEIL HITLER
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: ‘KOMM GIB MIR DEINE HAND’ BY THE BEATLES

dialogues.speaker: OPENING TITLES
dialogues.text: HOMETOWN WITH FOOTAGE OF HITLER’S RISE TO GOD STATUS -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo skips happily down the street, Heil Hitlering variou locals he passes by. He meets his best friend, YORKI, 10 chubby, gawky, clumsy, who waits for him in a doorway. Jogo Heil Hitler, Yorki!

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler, Jojo! gogo Are you ready for the best weekend ever?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Yes I am! Jogo Let’s go! They run off together, continuing to Heil Hitler everyone they meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo and Yorki sit with a large group of other young kids all dressed in Hitler Youth uniforms, in a sprawling fiel CAPTAIN KLENZENDORF, weathered, disillusioned, addresses crowd of kids. He has a DEAD-EYE and is accompanied by th awkwardly enthusiastic SUB-OFFICER FINKEL, and a brutish female instructor, FRAULEIN RAHM.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler, guys.

dialogues.speaker: FINKEL / FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler!

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Jungvolk, welcome to the Hitlerjugend training weekend in which we will make men and women of you all. My name is Captain Klenzendorf - you may call me Captain K.

dialogues.speaker: FINKEL
dialogues.text: Captain K! Woo!

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: -and this is Sub-Officer Finkel. And Fraulein Rahm. (beat) So, a little about me. Who am I and why am I here talking to a bunch of little titty-grabbers instead of leading my men into battle towards glorious death? Great question. I’ve asked it myself every day since Operation Screw-Up, where I lost a perfectly good eye in a totally preventable enemy attack. And according to my superiors, you need two eyes to be a meaningful part of the war effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. He picks up a rifle and quickly fires a shot, hitti target 100 yards away. The kids applaud. KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) Over the next two days you little critters will get to experience some of the things that the mighty German Army goes through every day. And even though it would appear our country’s on the back foot and that there really isn’t much hope us of winning this war, apparently we're doing just fine. (takes a breath, composes himself, he’s sad) Anyway. You boys have all been issued with your Deutsches Jungvolk Daggers. Jojo and Yorki inspect and admire their nice new DEUTSCHE JUNGVOLK (DJ) KNIVES. KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) These are very special and expensive weapons, you should never be without them. And don’t try to stab each other.

dialogues.speaker: FINKEL
dialogues.text: No stabbing! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: This is your first step towards being men. Today you boys will be involved in such activities as marching, bayonet drills, grenade throwing, trench digging, map reading, gas defense, camouflage, trap setting, ambush techniques, war games, firing guns and blowing stuff up. Huge cheers from the group of boys. Jojo and Yorki smile each other, this is going to be awesome. KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) The girls will practice important womanly duties such as dressing wounds, making beds, and learning how to get pregnant. Groans of disappointment from the girls. Klenzendorf hold the bridge of his nose as if preparing for the impending headache he’s about to endure over the weekend. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s get to it. The crowd of kids salute and start screaming in excitemen The older boys start yelling at smaller kids, rounding th up and y'know, being Nazis. Finkel and Rahm lead them off

dialogues.speaker: FINKEL
dialogues.text: On your feet you little Nazis! Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Move, move, move! More screaming from the kids.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: God help me. MONTAGE - HITLER YOUTH TRAINING CAMP... MUSIC CUE: ‘I DON’T WANT TO GROW UP’ BY TOM WAITS various scenes of Jojo and Yorki training with the Hitlerjugend. - A bunch of kids try and climb over obstacles and under nets. It’s mayhem. - KNIFE THROWING. Jojo and Yorki stand around in a group boys throwing their DJ knives from 10 FEET into a tree. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the knives stick, instead they fly off at dangero angles, one ricochets, lodging itself in another kid’s th - GUN RANGE. Jojo and some other kids aim their KARABINER RIFLES at a target in the distance. Jojo fires and, jumpi from the loudness of the shot, drops the rifle. - WAR GAME. The boys are separated into 2 groups, one sid wearing RED SASHES and the other GREEN. They chase each o round a clearing, pushing each other over and taking prisoners etc. Jojo and Yorki are taken prisoner instantl An older lad, CHRISTOPH, looks at them with disappointmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo sits in a group of boys and girls. One by one, somet overlapping, the children call out.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: Horns / Serpent tongue / Fangs / Green blood / Claws. Their teacher, FRAULEIN RAHM, proudly writes the children words, along with others, on a blackboard. Above them is heading: THE JEW. Finkel stands nearby, observing and tak notes.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Fantastisch! Excellent work children. You also forgot that the Jew is the offspring of Satan and sucks the blood of Christian children for their mitzvah. Gasps from the children. Finkel nods - I'm afraid so. FRAULEIN RAHM (CONT’D) It has been scientifically proven that we Aryans are 1000 times more advanced and civilised than any other race. Gasps and applause from the children. Fraulein Rahm smile FRAULEIN RAHM (CONT’D) Now, get your things together kids, it’s time to burn some books!

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: Yayyyy!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE BONFIRE burns. The children hold stacks of books. Jojo opens his bag and pulls out a small pile.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Is that it? Only 4 books? gogo It’s all I could find on the list. (reading the authors) Kafka... Brecht... Hesse losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws them into the fire, Yorki follows suit. The boo land among other burning authors, FREUD, MANN, PROUST HEMINGWAY, REMARQUE. The children skip and dance round the bonfire, throwing b into the inferno while Fraulein Rahm cackles maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An encampment. Tents glow under the night sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo and Yorki lie awake in sleeping bags, inspecting the new DJ KNIVES. gogo Imagine being in a battle, you've just run out of ammo, all you have is your DJ Knife. I would take down 20 of them before they got me. And I’d be laughing when they did.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: I don’t like that situation. I don’t want to die at all. Jogo Live Faithfully, Fight Bravely, and Die Laughing, Yorki, that’s the motto.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: I know but I wouldn’t be laughing. I'd probably be screaming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gogo Then I’m afraid you might not be cut out for Hitler’s personal guard. It’s really hard to get chosen y'know. You need to have perfect vision, perfect teeth and you're only allowed a little bit of fat.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: (prodding his chubbiness) Jews sound scary, huh? gogo Not to me. If I met one I’d kill it like that. (tries to snap his fingers) that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: But how would you know if you saw one? They can look just like us. JosO Oh I'd know. I’d feel it’s head for horns. And they smell like Brussels Sprouts.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I forgot about the Brussels Sprouts bit. gogo Imagine catching one and giving it to Hitler. That’d be a sure-fire way to get into his personal guard.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: He'd be so impressed. gogo Then we would become best friends.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: I thought I was your best friend gogo Yorki, you're my second best friend. First place is reserved for the Fihrer. He, and only he can have that spot, so unless you’re Hitler hiding in a fat little boy’s body I'd be happy with 2nd place. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: I’m just a kid in a fat kid’s body. gogo Case closed. Jojo rolls over and stares at the sky. JOJO (CONT’D) (whispering) Night papa, I hope you come home soon. Night Inga, I hope you're happy up there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo sits with a bunch of other kids. Two team leaders, CHRISTOPH and HANS, (21) smoke cigarettes and hold court. Christoph kisses a girl before turning to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: When you stand before the enemy and have to end his life, which of you will have the stomach for it? Everyone raises their hands. Jojo too, although a little slow.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is no room in Hitler's army for those who lack strength. We want hardened warriors who are prepared to kill at will. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER KIDS
dialogues.text: Yes / Sure / Oh absolutely

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: Johannes? Can you kill? gogo Pf£f, of course. I love killing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: Good... Hans uncovers a small cage nearby - it is filled with lit rabbits. Hans takes a bunny from the cage and holds it ou towards Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jogo Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: Wring its neck. Kill the rabbit gogo Oh, I’m ok. I might do it later.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: No later, NOW. Or are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gogo I’m not scared. I'm just allergic to fur and I don’t want itchy hands all weekend. Hans shoves the rabbit into Jojo's hands.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Place both hands around its neck and then one hard twist. He might scream but we'll just use the boot to finish it off. Rill... kill... Jojo, shaking now, holds the bunny and looks at it direct in the eye. He gulps. The boys join the chant

dialogues.speaker: OTHER KIDS
dialogues.text: Kill, Kill, Kill, Kill... The boys are like baying wolves; they crouch in around Jo as he leans over the rabbit. Jojo DROPS the bunny, trying to shoo it away. But it does run and Hans steps forward, grabs the rabbit, and snaps i neck. Shocked gasps and squeaks of horror from the kids. of them faints. Probably Yorki.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: Coward. Just like your father.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: He's not a coward, he’s in Italy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: No one has heard from him in two years. He's a deserting coward just like you.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s a deserter.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: No, he doesn’t do that, he fights. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: He’s scared and so are you. You're as scared as a rabbit. He kicks Jojo to the ground. Hans places a boot on his ne

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTOPH
dialogues.text: Scared little rabbit. Maybe we should snap your neck too. The rest of the kids taunt Jojo. He stands and runs into woods, trying to escape the laughter. Hans encourages the chant “Jojo Rabbit” as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo sits alone on a log, sobbing to himself. He looks up see a little BUTTERFLY flitting around by his feet... and then a voice comes from behind.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Poor Jojo, what’s wrong, little man’ Jojo turns around, it’s Adolf gogo Hi Adolf. Adolf takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Why so down in the dumps? A strong boy like yourself shouldn't be sad, you should be happy like a cloud! Clouds don’t care about anything! gogo They called me a coward. And my papa, they say he makes desserts instead of fighting. But I know he’s still fighting for you, for me, and for Germany.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Oh, of course he is! And he is also making nice desserts, nothing wrong with that. My God, his custard tarts are the only thing keeping up morale at the front. (beat) Want to tell me about the rabbit incident? What was that all about? (CONTINUED)
gogo They wanted me to kill it. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Meh, don’t worry about it. I couldn't care less. Just like a cloud. Jogo But now they call me a scared rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Well you want to know something? (Off Jojo's nod) Just because they’re small and delightfully cute doesn’t mean rabbits are cowards. The rabbit faces a dangerous world everyday, hunting carrots for his family... for his country. Forget those boys. They have their place and so do you. My empire will be made up of all animals, eagles, lions, elephants and even the mighty rabbit. Hitler offers Jojo a cigarette. gogo No thanks, I don't sm-~

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Can I give you some really good advice? Be the rabbit. The humble bunny can outwit all his enemies and that is why he is a hero. Be. The. Rabbit. He winks at Jojo who tries to wink back but still can onl manage a weird double wink-blink. Adolf wanders off. Just then, Yorki arrives.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Jojo! Are you alright Jojo? Who were you talking to? Jogo Nobody, I was just out here doing some push-ups for my muscles.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought you were crying. gogo Are you a teardrop specialist? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: No. gogo Case closed. Now, Yorki Dorky, it’s time for Jojo to show these pip-squeaks who is the real cowardly rabbit. He takes a deep breath and scurries off into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: I’m sorry what are you talking about? Jogo Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Jojo, where are you going? gogo To be the rabbit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Klenzendorf sits in a deck chair. He pulls the pi a HAND-GRENADE and hurls it into an open space. It EXPLOD REVEAL he is holding a lesson on hand-grenades. Hans, Christoph, and the rest of the boys watch from the safety a TRENCH.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Now lads, each of you will be given the opportunity to ignite and throw a grenade. I will personally be supervising each of you to make sure you don’t blow your eyes out or something. Now, who's first? Klaus. Come on lad. A boy steps up and holds out his hand to take a grenade. Klenzendorf goes to hand it to him there’s a sudden flurr Jojo bursts out of the bushes and onto the scene. Jogo Jojo rabbit! Jojo rabbit! Hunting carrots, Jojo rabbit! He jumps across the trench and, snatching the grenade fro Klenzendorf’s hand, continues into the clearing beyond. Suddenly Adolf appears, running next to Jojo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: This is amazing! We're like two human antelopes! Jojo pulls the PIN on the grenade and screams an ungodly cry as he hurls it into the air. It bounces off a tree th ricochets backwards, landing at his feet. Jogo Scheisse.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Shiiiiiit. BOOM. Jojo is blown up.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Don't do that. cur TO: EXT. WOODS - JOJO’S POV JoJo's POV - Jojo is being carried on a stretcher through woods. Klenzendorf’s face leans in to shot.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: (lying BADLY) Don’t worry kid, you're doing fine. You look great. Yorki leans in, his eyes go wide, he faints. Adolf leans in. Gives Jojo the THUMBS UP. But he looks worried and disgusted. He also faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're in an ambulance. Fraulein Rahm leans in, her face contorts in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Oh God, he looks like a Picasso painting. (beat) Cubist period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo's stretcher is being wheeled down a corridor.  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright lights. The doctor hovers over us, we see INSTRUME Klenzendorf steps into shot, addresses the DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: His mother’s going to kill me. Adolf leans in, smiles and gives us the thumbs up. Jojo’s BLOODIED THUMB comes into view. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: = A woman’s face comes in to focus. This is Jojo’s mother ROSIE BETZLER. As she reaches the bed, she stops, puts he hand over her mouth. Her eyes well with tears.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Jojo... my darling cub. = Jojo’s hand raises into shot, reaching out to her. The floods with tears, de-focuses, and fades. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - BEDROOM ~ MORNING A NEW JOJO stands before us in front of the mirror. He ha scars on one side of his face, his RIGHT ARM appears stif and he now has a limp.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey kid. In the mirror Jojo sees his mother standing at the door, smiling. She hugs him tightly, making growling noises.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My darling little cub. gogo Why so happy? Your son is ugly like a monster.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You're no monster. You're still my beautiful Jojo. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides the doctors are confident those scars will heal and you'll get most of the movement back in your leg. But I’m just happy to have you back home. Jogo I'll never be in Hitler’s SS Guard now.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You're fine as you are. gogo I need to be better.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You need to be you. Mama Lion worries about her cub, that’s all. Especially when papa Lion isn’t here. oso Or Inga.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Or Inga. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - LOUNGE ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Jojo tries to tie his bootlaces but has trouble with only good hand. Rosie kneels down and helps him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: A few more months and you'll get it. You grab the rabbit by the tail, wrap it around his ear, tie it all up and then stuff him back (on) down the hole. (then) Now, we better get on our way. Getting out of the house will do wonders for your recuperation. Rosie helps Jojo into his jacket. He catches another glim of himself in a mirror. gogo I don’t want to go out there.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly, of course you do: gogo I look stupid. People will stare. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Let them! Enjoy the attention, kid. Not everyone is lucky enough to look stupid. What I wouldn’t give. She looks in the mirror. ROSIE (CONT’D) Instead I am cursed to look incredibly... attractive... Entranced, she moves in, almost kissing her reflection. ROSIE (CONT’D) Now, you're going to pluck up your courage, walk out that door and have a fantastic adventure. Okay? gogo (nodding, unsure) Okay. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - FRONT DOOR - MOMENTS LATER Rosie parts the blinds on the front door and peeks outsid

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Field Marshall Jojo, looks like the coast is clear. Now... Looking over her shoulder, she produces a large, plain biscuit. It’s all covert and over the top, but fun for Jo ROSIE (CONT’D) -many good men died to bring you this. It’s a special potato-flour biscuit for emergencies. Emergencies dammit! Not only is it a biscuit, but it also doubles as an eye-patch in case you are invited to a pirate party. It could pass for a shield, an earring, a spare wheel, and even a believable discus should you find yourself participating in a biscuit Olympiad. And in a pinch it also acts as a type of food to sustain you until dinner. (then, peeking out the door once more) Field Marshall Jojo, you're our top man. Prepare to leave the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo smiles and prepares himself, playing along. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo Is it dangerous? Rosie smiles and winks.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Extremely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo and Rosie enter the HITLER YOUTH OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant room. Nazi Propaganda adorns the office and large SWASTIKA BANNERS hang on the walls. The woman from the HJ Camp, FRAULEIN RAHM, sits at a desk, staring intensely at large framed photo of HITLER on the wall. A couple of TEENAGE YOUTH OFFICERS loiter about practicin stabbing things with their DJ Knives while some BDM GIRLS operate a PRINTING PRESS which spits out pages of PROPAGA FINKEL is off to the side listening to music through HEADPHONES and dancing like Ian Curtis from Joy Division,

dialogues.speaker: HEIL HITLER
dialogues.text: Fraulein Rahm jumps.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAEM
dialogues.text: Jesus. Captain Klenzendorf emerges from his office.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Jojo Betzler! Looking good, friend! (beat, to Rosie) Frau Betzler. Rosie walks up to Klenzendorf and kicks him in the balls. drops to the ground. KLENZENDORF (CONT‘D) Owwww

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Ok, that’s that. Because of you, my kid has lost the feeling in his arm and can’t walk properly and has a messed up face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: But he stole the hand-grenade!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah. Now you're going to take care of him while I go to work. You'll give him a job and make sure he feels included. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Got it. I really got it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: (standing) Wow. Ok let’s start this again. Everyone, this is Johannes Betzler. Remember he stole a hand-grenade and blew himself up and as a result I got kicked in the nuts by his mother.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You sure did.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I also got demoted if that makes you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: It does.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: So, Jojo. Great to see you. Alive. I'm sure we can figure out something for you to do (beat) Ideas guys? Come on!

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Well, we need someone to walk the clones. They haven't been outside in weeks and some of them are malfunctioning. REVEAL: In the corner of the room we see about a DOZEN 8 OLD CLONES, doing various chores, typing, sweeping, paint playing chess. Some are just standing there dribbling FRAULEIN RAHM (CONT’D) Also, you could hand out some of this propaganda and deliver these conscriptions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ai.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo I don’t suppose I could be conscripted could 1?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (shaking her head throughout ) Great idea! I give you full permission to send this ten year old child off to war Someone give this guy a gun! gogo Actually mother I’m feeling quite fit and would be more than happy to fight at the front.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Get in line kid. Besides, you’re still on the mend. For now you can start small. Conscripts and propaganda. gogo As you wish. I will execute my orders with precision and strength, like a precise... boulder. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Just deliver the stuff , kid.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: Jawohl! He turns on his heels and is OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo pins up some posters of HITLER in a stoic pose, look off into the distance. Below him is the propaganda slogan

dialogues.speaker: ONE PEOPLE, ONE EMPIRE, ONE LEADER
dialogues.text: Jojo turns and joins his mother who is staring at a make- shift GALLOWS. FIVE BODIES, men and women hang from the c beam gogo Yuck. He tries to turn away but Rosie takes his head and turns back to the view. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Look. gogo What did they do?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) What they could. (beat) Come on. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo pastes more propaganda and public announcements arou town, A truck drives past and we see one of the forest bullies, HANS, on the back with a bunch of other young soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Hey, Jojo Rabbit! Oh my God, look at your face! Ewwww! (beat) Look at me, I ama soldier now and you are just a pathetic postman! I am a soldier! I'm going to war! (then, chanting) Jojo Rabbit! Jojo Rabbit! The chant continues as Hans and his buddies laugh at Jojo INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM Jojo arrives home. Jogo Mama! I'm home. He drops his satchel and heads for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mama, Field Marshall Jojo is home. Suddenly, a noise from upstairs. A small THUD. Jojo looks JOJO (CONT’D) Mama Lion?  23. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - LATER Jojo slowly makes his way down the upstairs hall, looking rooms. He moves towards his sister’s room. He takes a mom before stepping into the room and wandering around. He lo at a photo of INGA, smiles and puts it back. Then... Jojo notices something on the other side of the room. On ground sits a picture in a frame. He picks it up and then Sees: A THIN CUT IN THE WALLPAPER in the shape of a door. Jojo takes his trusty DJ KNIFE and pries the door OPEN. A Jojo's eyes adjust he begins making out objects. At first it’s only BOOKS. Jogo The bad books. It’s not allowed. Then he sees a candle, bedding, a plate, a fork, AND... .+.a SKINNY, PALE CREATURE hunched in the corner, its fac partially hidden beneath her hair, dark eyes staring back Screaming with fright, Jojo drops his knife and stumbles out into the room. Frozen in fear, Jojo stares into the darkness beyond the secret door. Slowly, a pale hand wraps around the corner, then a skinny GIRL emerges. This is ELSA KORR (17)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Hi Jojo bolts as fast as he can, out the door and downstairs where he trips and lands on the bottom landing. ELSA (0.S.) (CONT’D) Little boy... STOMP. STOMP. STOMP. Footsteps on the stairs get louder. Eventually Elsa rounds the corner halfway up the stairs. Jogo What do you want? Are you a ghost?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (smiling spookily) Sure. A ghost. gogo Get out of my house! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Johannes, that’s no way to treat a ghost. Jogo Why do you live in the wall?!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Where else should a ghost live? Beat. Jojo leaps up and tries to make a run for it, but before he can reach the door she grabs him by the scruff the neck and slams him into a wall. ELSA (CONT’D) Don’t make me run kid, I’m far too hungry and you know how much we love the taste of blood. Jojo checks his sheath for his DJ KNIFE but it’s empty. E reveals the knife in her hand ELSA (CONT’D) Lose something? (beat) I'm not a ghost Johannes, I’m something worse. But I think you already know that don’t you? You know what I am. gogo No. She presses the knife to his throat,

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yes. Say it. gogo (he gulps, futile) Jew.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Gesundheit. gogo You can’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Well your mother invited me so I suppose that makes me her guest. gogo No. It’s not allowed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What will you do sweet Hitlerchen? Jojo's eyes dart towards the door, and then the telephone ELSA (CONT’D) Of course. Go on then, tell them. But you know what happens if you do? I'll say you helped me. And your mother too. Then we'll all be kaput. and if you tell her you know about me... just one word... (raising the knife to his neck) I’ll do the world a great big favour and cut your Nazi head off. Got it? She releases him and backs away, still holding the knife. ELSA (CONT’D) I think I‘11 hold onto this. It’s pretty. She wanders back up the stairs leaving Jojo in shock. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Jojo sits on his bed, petrified

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sheesh, that was intense. Adolf is sitting next to him. gogo What am I gonna do??

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Honestly, NO idea. There could be more of them. In the walls. Hundreds of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around at the walls. They huddle closer togethe ADOLF (CONT‘D) How the hell did she get control like that? gogo She used her powers I guess. Mind control. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: oh, typical. Did you see how fast she moved? And now she’s got your fancy knife. Jogo I know! My knife! Adolf offers Jojo a cigarette. He waves it away.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: You're definitely in a pickle. (he snaps his fingers) Got itt (then) Ah damn, actually I don’t have it. But then. gogo ADOLF (CONT'D) Got it. Got it! (beat ) (beat) I have to negotiate. You have to burn the house down and blame Winston Churchill. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok. Try your idea first. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Jojo enters Inga/Elsa's room. He's wearing household obje as ARMOUR; A POT sits on his head, he holds a KITCHEN KNI and he has a TRASH-CAN LID for a shield. He goes to the CLOSED secret door and knocks twice. KNOCK-KNOCK. gogo Excuse me? Hello? Little girl? um, Jew girl in the wall? (beat) Yoohoo, Jew? Just over his shoulder Adolf encourages Jojo to continue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok well, I’1l just say what I have to say and that’s this: I’m not scared of you and I think you should find somewhere else to live. Adolf taps his watch. Jojo nods. JOJO (CONT’D) ok? From behind, in his ear, where Adolf was just standing

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Not okay. Jojo spins, she’s right behind him, holding his knife smiling. She kicks him hard against his trash-can lid shi He flies back, hitting the wall and collapsing in a heap. Elsa picks up the KITCHEN KNIFE, flips it in her hand. ELSA (CONT’D) Get the hell out of my room. Jogo Argh!!!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: She’s pretty rude, y’know. That’s just my 2 pfennige... INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S BEDROOM - DAY Back in the safety of Jojo’s bedroom, Jojo and Adolf pace

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: -+.and now she’s got TWO knives! Jogo I know!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: How are you going to chop up stuff? gogo I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: And she’s still up there! That thing. That... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitler lig They start 28. Jogo Jew.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Jew yeah. What do we do about it? Jogo You think of something!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Oh, now I’m the expert? nts another cigarette, offers it to Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: I don’t smoke! Stop offering me damn cigarettes! I’m TEN!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Sorry, this is stressful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pacing, thinking, pacing, thinking

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s talk like turkeys. I guess you can’t tell your mother or the Jew will cut off your Nazi head. No real way around that right now. But y’know, there’s no reason this thing in the attic needs to ruin your life. You could actually use it to your advantage. gogo How?

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Well, when someone tries to use mind- powers on me, you know what I do? Use mind powers back on them. Remember last year when that one-armed pirate, Von Stauffenberg, tried to blow me up with a table bomb?

dialogues.speaker: JOO
dialogues.text: Yeah, you survived.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Correct-a-mundo. But the only reason I survived, apart from having bomb-proof legs, is because I outwitted old Von Stauffy. I let him think I was dead when in actual fact I was fine. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo's eyes He jumps o out on Joj INT. Jogo’ Jojo sits 29. (2)

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By pretending I was dead I drew out the traitors. So, what are you going to do? gogo Pretend I'm dead?

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Exactly. Wait. No. I think what I mean is this: Make her feel safe and she will drop her guard and then you will be the one in control. gogo Reverse Psychology.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Don’t complicate things. Just use my backwards mind power trick on her and you'll be fine. (checks his watch) I gotta go. We're having unicorn for dinner at my place tonight. s go wide.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Concentrate, Jojo! (beat) Ok good luck, and remember that ancient, saying: a Jew living in your wall is better than two Jews flying around with their bat wings, climbing down chimneys and eating innocent Nazis. And don’t give her any more KNIVES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut the window. o's worried face.

dialogues.speaker: S HOUSE
dialogues.text: in living room, staring into space. We hear a car pull up, then footsteps. Rosie enters the h and into the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Darling cub, why are you still up? Did you eat? (beat) I was just taking a long walk and having a think. Sorry, I lost track of time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rosie notices one of his laces are untied again

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (crouching to tie them) Oh, your laces, you really must learn-— JOsO I heard her.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What? who? Jogo (pointing upstairs) Inga. Her ghost. Rosie walks out and into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (laughing) For Heaven’s sake what are you talking about? He follows her. Rosie takes some bread from the cupboard starts opening draws. gogo I heard noises upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Oh come on, ghosts?? We have rats in the attic and yes I’ve heard them too. Actually I’ve been meaning to say, you probably shouldn’t go up there till I've caught them all, they have germs and I don’t need you getting sick. Okay? gogo Okay mama. I’1l watch out for those dirty rats. Rosie slams the drawer shut.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Where are all our god damn knives?! INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - NIGHT Jojo stands at the door to the bathroom as his mother lay the tub. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Mama, do you miss papa?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Like the sun misses the moon. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - ROSIE'S ROOM - NIGHT Jojo watches as his mother fixes her hair in the mirror. They're wearing matching pyjamas. gogo And do you miss Inga?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Like the moon misses the sun. Jogo And do you love anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Apart from you and Papa and Inga? MYSELF obviously. Pff. (beat) Now, I left my favourite scarf in a dream, could you be a darling and go get it for me? gogo Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Bedtime! INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S ROOM - NIGHT Rosie tucks Jojo into bed. gogo Are you going to bed too?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Soon. I need to tidy some things first. gogo What things?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Mama things. Boy, you really have to trust me, I’m the boss here. Ok? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beat. She smiles and strokes his face. gogo I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Good boy. She WINKS. Jojo tries a return wink but can’t. ROSIE (CONT’D) Like this. She demonstrates and winks again, Jojo attempts a return but isn’t getting it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, but with just one eye. You can do it. They continue this hopeless exchange a few more times. Sh eventually keeps one of his eyes open with her finger and “winks” his other eye for him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go! You got it! She kisses him good-night and turns out the light. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT A match is struck and a candle lit. As our eyes adjust to flickering light we can make out Elsa sitting in the darkness. We then follow the match to find Rosie. She produces bread, some pickle and a slice of cheese. Elsa begins gobbling it down.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You have to be more quiet. He heard noises up here. He can’t know. If he does it’s the end of you. If I have to choose between you and my son... (beat) I won't know where to send you. You hear me? He must not know because if he knows, then they know.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You could reason with him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You don’t know him. He’s a fanatic. It took him three weeks to get over the fact his grandfather wasn’t blonde.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yet you let him go to the Hitler Youth you encourage it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: To get him out of the house and give you space. (beat) You think I don’t hate it? It’s a hard thing to be a mother. But even harder is to be the mother of one of them. How do you love a son like this, a kid who believes the things he does? (beat) In the end, you have no choice. I know he’s still in there somewhere, the little boy who loves to play and runs to you because he’s scared of thunder. And that’s all you have left, belief — hope that your only remaining child is not just another ghost.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Perhaps we're all ghosts now but we just. don’t know it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Perhaps. You've lived more lifetimes than most.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I haven’t lived at all. And if this is living, this hole in the wall and all this darkness, then what will death be like?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: The final escape. But that’s the easy way out. You're being challenged; they say you can’t live, that you won't live. If that comes true then they win

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: They've been winning so far. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: They'll never win. That is the power you have - as long as there is someone alive somewhere then they lose. They didn’t get you yesterday, or today. Make tomorrow the same. She strokes Elsa's shoulder. ROSIE (CONT’D) Tomorrow must be the same. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S ROOM - NIGHT Jojo sits upright in bed, wide awake. He hears a door clo upstairs. gogo Bad Mama. Jojo punches his pillow and angrily dives back onto his b cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER: Jojo swimming down through the water. He pass Adolf who waves as he goes by. Jojo emerges at the surface where we see other WOUNDED ME amputees, burn victims, etc. Adolf emerges from the pool and paddles around the wounde soldiers, doing a very bad job of hiding his disgust. Jojo looks over to see his mother talking to Klenzendorf the side of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oso Owwww! Lying on a mattress, Jojo yells in pain as FRAULEIN RAHM stretches his LEG.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Good, stretch, you must stretch. That's it. Pain is your friend. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soon your leg will be only a little bit deformed and pointless. I’m going to recommend another month off school because your face might scare the other kids. She walks away, Jojo remains lying down on his back.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Jojo baby, I have to go. His mother’s OXFORDS enter frame, next to his head. They click-clack on the tiles in front of him and he watches a her shoes spin next to his head

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll see you at home. I’1l see you at home. He nods. Rosie kisses his head, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo limps over to Klenzendorf and Finkel. gogo Hi Captain K.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn’t Herr Handgrenade himself. How's the leg? gogo Pretty much healed. It only eighty percent hurts. What are you guys doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I’m also being made to teach the HJ boys water warfare training. In case they ever need to go to battle in a swimming pool. gogo can I ask you about Jews?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Oh God, why? Jogo What should I do if I see one? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: If you see a Jew then we tell the Gestapo and they tell the SS and then they go and kill the Jew. And anyone who helped the Jew. And, because these are very paranoid times, probably some other people just in case. It’s a pretty drawn out process. Jojo gulps. gogo Even if the Jew hypnotised someone to make them hide the Jew in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I'd be amazed if that could happen.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: It can. It happened to my uncle. This Jew hypnotised him into drunk fishing and he drowned. (to Jojo, suddenly probing) Did you see one? A Jew? gogo Nope. I’m not sure I'd be able to tell if I did.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Me neither. Without their funny hats it’s damn near impossible. Someone should write a book on the subject. It’d make everything a lot easier. This sparks an idea in Jojo’s head. A WHISTLE is heard and we cut to see a group of HITLER JU KIDS, fully dressed and wearing boots and BACKPACKS sit o the side of the pool. They all JUMP IN and immediately st sinking. KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) (to Finkel) Finkel, they’re drowning. Come on. (to Jojo) See you later little man. Klenzendorf and Finkel jump in the pool and begin rescuin the drowning kids. Out on Jojo, wheels spinning as he makes a plan.  37. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - MORNING Holding a SOUP LADLE as a weapon, Jojo approaches Elsa’s door. He knocks twice again KNOCK-KNOCK. The door opens and Elsa sits in the doorway. She still ha the two knives from earlier. gogo Ok, here’s the situation. If I tell on you, you'll be in big trouble and I don’t think you want that. But then you’ll tell on me and my mother and we'll be in trouble which I don’t want. And if you tell my mother I know, then she'll kick you out, which you don’t want. And if I tell my mother I know, then you'll cut off my head, which I also don’t want. (beat) So it’s a Mexican stalemate.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It’s just a normal stalemate. gogo I have some conditions for allowing you to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Conditions? Jogo Yes. I will not cause any trouble for you if you promise to tell me everything about the Jewish race.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Ok. We're like you but human. Done. Jogo Please take this seriously. I want to know all your secrets. Kindly refrain from sitting on my sister’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Why? She doesn’t need it. gogo You know nothing of my sister. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Inga and I were friends. I remember you: Such a funny boy. gogo Enough with the small talk. Elsa laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Ok. Obviously we are demons who love money, right? Jogo (writing it down) Obviously. Everyone knows that.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: But what people don’t know is that we are also allergic to food. Jogo What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Cheese, bread, meat. Those things will kill us instantly. So if you're thinking of ending my life, that’s the fastest way. Also biscuits. Lethal. Jojo writes this down, stops. He gets it. gogo very funny. Anyway, there’s not enough food for you so I don’t know what you're going to do.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Your mother managed to find some bread She's kind. She treats me like a person. Jogo But you're not. Not a proper person. She looks him up and down.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Are you? Jogo How dare you, Jew. You are weak like.. an eyelash. I am born of Aryan ancestry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My blood is the colour of a pure red rose and my eyes are blue like sapphires- Suddenly, Elsa has Jojo in a headlock, twisting his weak behind him. He winces in pain. JOJO (CONT’D) Ow ow ow ow ow ow... She covers his mouth, suffocating him.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muffled, quiet) Mmmph!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Break free. gogo Mmrrmmph,

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Break free, great Aryan. (leaning in close) There are no weak Jews. I am descended from those who wrestle angels and kill giants. We were chosen by God. You were chosen by a pathetic little man who can’t even grow a full moustache. His struggle is useless, he cannot break her grip. She releases him and pushes him onto Inga’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The stronger race, huh? She goes into her hideout and closes the door behind her. Jojo sits there, not sure how else to proceed. Jogo Ok, that’s enough for today. Well continue tomorrow. Okay? (beat) Okay? (then ) Okay. Jojo packs his book away and leaves.  40. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON Adolf is dressed as a Native American. He offers Jojo a p on his peace-pipe.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you want to play Cowboys and Indians? It might help take your mind off the whole Jew in the attic thing. gogo She doesn’t want to talk to me. This book is going to be harder to write than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: You're doing great, Jojo. I believe in you 100 percent. Suddenly we hear the front door open and Rosie bursting i flustered. She closes the door loudly:

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallo, I'm home! Adolf scurries around the room in a panic, looking for somewhere to hide. Finding nothing, he hugs the wall. gogo (whispering) She can’t see you.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: (whispering) I know. Because I’m blending in with my surroundings. He’s not.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes) It also helps if I can’t see her. Unseen by Jojo, Rosie moves to the fireplace and pulls so small pieces of printed paper from her pocket. She LIGHTS them and throws them into the hearth.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. She’s burning something. That's suspicious. What’s she burning? (yelling at Rosie) What are you burning? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jogo She can’t hear you.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Oh... (then, screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM - NIGHT As MUSIC plays on a record player, Jojo and Rosie sit at table, not speaking. Both of them eyeball each other suspiciously. It’s definitely awkward and as we pull out WIDE SHOT, we see Adolf has been sitting at the table thi whole time. He makes a gesture to Jojo that he should probably leave them to it. As he exits he winks at Jojo. Rosie winks at Jojo too. gogo Why are you so happy?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Things are changing. The Allies have taken Italy. France will be next and the war will soon be over. gogo God Dammit. Why does that make you happy? You hate your country that much?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I love my country. It’s war I hate. It’s pointless and stupid and the sooner we have peace the better. gogo The war will end but it will be the Reich who stands tall and proud. We will crush our enemies into dust, and when they are destroyed we shall use their graves as toile

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Hey! No more politics ok? Dinner is neutral ground. This table is Switzerland. Let's eat. Jojo watches Rosie. She barely touches her food. Jogo You aren't eating? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Not that hungry. I might have some later. For now, I’m just going to chew on these grapes. Jogo Well I’m especially hungry tonight. So maybe I‘1l just finish yours. Silence. Glaring at her son, Rosie angrily eats her food.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: How was your day, Johannes? gogo Oh you know, just wandered around being a deformed kid with nothing to live for.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You're not deformed. Jogo My face looks like a street map, woman.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: That's not my fault, you did that to yourself. gogo I wouldn't expect you to understand. If my father were here, he’d get it

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Well. He's. Not. Jogo I. Know. And instead I’m stuck with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie takes a breath, then swigs deeply from a wine bottl

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You want your dad? Hmm? gogo Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah? gogo Yeah! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: ok fine! She storms out of the room. A second later she returns wearing her husband’s military jacket. She walks to the fireplace and scoops up some ash and rub across her face to make a “beard”. Putting on a deep voic she slams her fist down and yells in Jojo's face. ROSIE (CONT’D) (Dad voice) Don’t ever talk to your goddamned mother like tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo sits back, shocked at the outburst. Rosie walks away stands in the corner. After a few beats... ROSIE (CONT’D) Paul, what happened? Her back still to us, Rosie begins a conversation between herself and her husband.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Dad) I yelled at the kid. (Rosie) You should apologize. (Dad, to Jojo) Sorry kid. (Rosie) You call that an apology? Do it properly. He misses you. Talk to him. Rosie-Dad approaches the table and crouches before Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Dad, to Jojo) Jojo, I know you miss me but I’m out there trying to make a difference in the world. And while I’m gone I need you to take care of my Rosie for me. Can you do that? Jojo nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Dad) can ya? gogo Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (Dad) Thanks. She's doing what she can.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (Daa) We've got a good kid there, Rosie. I love him to bits. Jogo I love you too, dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (Dad) Almost as much as I love this stuff! She grabs a bottle of wine from the table and takes a big swig from it. ROSIE (CONT’D) (Dad) Boy does that taste good. Reminds me of dancing with my Rosie at The Red Salon Remember, honey? (Rosie) I do, babe. She stumbles across to the RECORD PLAYER, turns up the mu and starts dancing like a loon in the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Dad voice) Hey kid, don’t just sit there. Come dance with your parent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo laughs and gives in. He goes and dances with his mot Rosie holds her son close, squeezing him tightly, kissing him, not letting go. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - MORNING A PEN skids across the floor. Elsa stops it and picks it gogo So, I'd like you to draw a picture of where Jews live. A typical hive; where you all sleep, eat, and where the Queen Jew lays the eggs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You really are an idiot. gogo Come on. We have a lot of work to do. Elsa takes his pen and paper and starts drawing

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Where Jews live. Ok. Jogo And tell me about your family.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'll tell you about Jews but you are not privileged to know about my family. Jogo I need background.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Why are you hanging around with me? Don’t you have any friends?

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Of course. Yorki.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yorki.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Amongst others.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Pit... Jogo You don’t have anyone.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I have Nathan. Jogo Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: My fiancée. I have him. gogo Where is he? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Fighting in the resistance. She holds out a LOCKET with TWO PHOTOS inside. One is a pretty picture of Elsa, the other of a handsome man, NATH

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He proposed to me on the banks of the Fluss. He knelt down like a proper gentleman, recited a poem by Rilke, and when I said ‘yes’ we danced into the night. Jogo Snore. Who's Rilke?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: A great Poet. Nathan’s favourite. gogo Oooh, Nathan's favourite, yayyy

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: He's coming to rescue me and then we’1l go live in Paris. gogo You would turn your back on Germany forever.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It turned on me first. Jogo Yeah well we don’t need you. You and your stupid boyfriend can shut up and go live in dumb... Cheese - Snail - Baguette - Land.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Now, now, just because you don’t have a girlfriend. Jogo Pah! I'm too busy for girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: One day you'll make time. He rolls his eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll think of nothing else. You'll meet someone and spend your days dreaming of the moment you can hold her in your arms again. That’s love. Jojo takes a moment, under her spell. He breaks out of it Jogo Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Finished. Elsa places her finished drawing next to Jojo. It’s of hi Underneath she has written the word DUMMKOPF. gogo I said to draw where Jews live. This is just a stupid picture of my head. She pushes her finger into his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: That’s where we live. She slinks back into her hideout, closes the wall behind Jojo stares at his drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo walks down an aisle of the local library. He scans t scant shelves and finds what he was looking for; RILKE: P AND ESSAYS. He pulls it out and secretly stuffs it into h jacket. He turns around and sees Hitler stuffing his own Jacket with about 20 books. They spill out onto the floor

dialogues.speaker: HITLER
dialogues.text: Great thinking, Rabbit. We’ll use these books to make a fake floor that she can fall through, straight into a nest of piranhas or hot lava. Or BOTH (cackling sinisterly) She won't know what hit her! Oso shh.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Shh? You shush. Let’s get a book and go Libraries are dumb.  4g. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S ROOM - DAY Jojo writes a letter at his desk, the Rilke poetry book l next to him. Hitler lays on the bed reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is a really good idea, what we're doing right now. If she had a heart, this would break it clean in two. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - AFTERNOON Elsa sits in an armchair. Jojo walks in gogo I have something to tell you. I came across an old letter from Nathan - your fiancée — addressed to you. It’s quite lucky I found it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: A letter from Nathan. I'll read it. Pause. Jojo reads his letter. JOsO (CONT'D) Dear Elsa, this is hard for me to say but I don’t want to marry you anymore. I found another woman and we laugh a lot and do the tongue kiss. It’s like my favourite poet Rilke says: “We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go.” So goodbye and sorry about letting you go. From Nathan, your ex-fiancée. PS. I am not really in the resistance T was lying. I am unemployed and quite fat now. Tears well in her eyes and she retreats into her hiding space, upset. She closes the secret door, leaving Jojo al INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S ROOM - AFTERNOON Jojo is back at his desk, writing another letter  49. INT. JOJO'S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - AFTERNOON Jojo's back. He knocks lightly on Elsa’s wall. KNOCK-KNOCK. The door remains closed. Jogo Hi. Um, don’t open the door but I actually forgot there was a second letter. I forgot I had it. I’1] just read it. (reading) Dear Elsa. I just wanted to say that I don’t want to break up with you now. I changed my mind because I don’t want you to kill yourself over me which a couple of girls have done in the past and it’s pretty stressful. (beat) I need you to stay alive. Thank God you are being taken care of by that kid, who I must say is a remarkable young man. Beyond his years. And brave too. (beat) And let's still get married sometime - even though I truly am unemployed and have nothing much going for me. I don’t even know how to tie a knot or read a map. Yours, Nathan. Beat. The door opens, revealing Elsa looking back. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - LATER CLOSE UP on Jojo, mid-discussion with Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: Beethoven.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Einstein. gogo Bach.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Gerschwin. soso Brahms. Mozart. Wagner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Musicians, is that all you have?! gogo Rilke.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Oh of course, your favourite, Rilke Jewish mother. gogo Dietrich, then.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (clicking her fingers) Houdini. gogo Nooooo.. .

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Believe it brother. Just ask Pissaro, Modigliani, Man Ray, Gertrude Stein, Mr. Moses and the king of them all, Jesus Christi, Amen. She does a MAGEN DAVID POWER MOVE with her hands. gogo You're just saying any old name now. I've never heard of these people and now I’m fed up. He goes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Hey. (he stops) If you find any more of those letters, will you let me know? gogo Sure. Ok. (beat) Bye. We stay with Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Bye.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo and Rosie lie around on the banks of the river.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: These banks used to be full of lovers. There'd be singing, dancing, romance

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: There’s no time for romance, we're at war.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: There’s always time for romance, babe One day you’ll meet someone special. gogo Why does everyone keep telling me that?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Who else tells you? Jogo Everyone. Anyway, it’s a stupid idea

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You're stupid. Love is the strongest thing in the world. gogo I think you'll find that metal is the strongest thing in the world, followed closely by dynamite and then muscles. (beat) Besides, I wouldn’t even know it if I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Surprise, surprise, your shoelaces are undone. Again. (she ties his laces) You'll know it when it happens. You'll feel it. A pain.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: In my arse I bet.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Nope, in your tummy. And your heart. Like butterflies. It’s like you're full of butterflies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo Yuck.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yuck. Come on Shitler, let’s get a move on She stands. Jojo gets to his feet but trips. His shoelace are tied together. Jogo Hey!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Haha! Oh kid, what’s wrong? She helps him to his feet and pushes him along, he falls again, laughing. Jogo Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Get it together, man. I’m worried about you, are you drunk? (to a passer-by) Excuse me, can you help? My child is drunk. Jogo (laughing) Don't believe her!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: “I'm Jojo and I shouldn't trust pretty ladies to tie my shoelaces...” He gets up and tries to chase her. They play like this, h tripping over, trying to catch his mother, as locals watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shoelaces now properly tied, Jojo and his mother walk along the banks of the river. She walks next to Jojo but an elevated retaining wall so her feet are next to his he

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You're growing up too fast. A ten year old shouldn't be celebrating war or talking politics. You should be having fun, climbing trees, and then falling out of those trees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo But the Fiihrer says that when we win, it is us young boys who will rule the world.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Pah! The Reich is dying. We’re going to lose this war and then what will you do? All I'm saying is that life is a gift and therefore we must celebrate it, hold on to it. We have to dance to show God we are grateful to be alive. She does a small twirl next to him, her shoes spinning ne his head. gogo Well I won’t dance. Dancing’s for people who don’t have a job.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Dancing’s for people who are free. It’s escape from all of this. gogo Well then you're free to dance your way home. I’1l ride! He jumps on his bicycle and pedals away. She gives chase

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Oh no you don’t! No one can stop me! She jumps on her bike and pedals after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo and Rosie ride through the countryside. A truck of wounded and battle weary soldiers pass by, the young faces sunken and devoid of hope. Rosie waves.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Welcome back, boys! Now go home and kiss your mothers! This makes the boys smile and they wave back, cheering INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S ROOM - AFTERNOON Jojo sits on Inga’s bed, Elsa is nearby (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo No news from Nathan today I’m afraid. He's probably doing something amazing like reading a book or growing a beard. Jojo sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What's wrong? After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want me to tell you about the Jews? (Off his look) Get comfortable. (beat) Okay, in the beginning we used to live in caves, deep, deep in the centre of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: Wait. Jojo takes a pen and starts writing in his book.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Scary places full of strange and wonderful creatures all with one thing in common... gogo (nodding, knowingly) Stealing the ends of penises.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (laughing) No you idiot. A love of art. gogo No cutting penises off?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You want the story or not? gogo You may continue. But I know it’s true, the penis thing. Rabbis use them for earplugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes elegant hai back to Jo: 55. (2)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Aaaand moving on. So, after many years of developing magic and spells, we slowly moved out of the caves and into the towns. Some of us stayed in the caves, in our normal bodies. gogo Which are... blobs or something?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Well, I'll draw them for you. Jojo's book and starts drawing. Jojo watches her nds as they create the picture. She hands the book jo; it is a beautiful sketch of a WEIRD creature that is more like an ELF or FAIRY. Definitely not Jewish monster. He writes ELSA (CONT’D) It would be better with colour. Jogo Where’s the horns?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Um, they’re under the hair. gogo Where are yours?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm too young. They grow when you turn 21. gogo Ahhh... that down too.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Anyway, these days we live among normal humans but often we will take over a house and hang from the ceiling when we sleep, like bats. Oh, one interesting thing is that we can read each other's minds. Jogo Everyone's minds? What about German minds? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: No, their heads are too thick for us to penetrate. Like birds, our true language sounds like singing. Crystals, glass and gold. Jogo (writing) Attracted to shiny things... but also ugly things, Jews love ugliness. That's another thing we learned in school. (beat) Ugly things yes? You love them? Elsa regards this 10 year-old kid writing as fast as he c a manic look on his face. A small smile creeps across her

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmm yes, ugly things. He pauses, catches a glimpse of himself in a mirror on th other side of the room. We see his scarred face. He regis his “ugliness” and goes back to writing. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - JOJO’S BEDROOM - LATER Jojo enters his room with a pep in his step. He sees Adol sitting in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: You two seem to be getting on well. gogo No, I just... I was making sure she was still alive.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: What do you care? gogo I don’t, But I also don’t want a dead person in my house. How would you like it? ADOLF. (wiggling his toes) I wouldn’t care. I’m tough. All the time you guys are spending together... I have to admit, it makes me uncomfortable. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOO
dialogues.text: Well, you suggested it in the first place. Besides, it’s for the book.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay, sorry. You're right. Oh no, I've made it weird between us, haven’t I? Is it weird? Oh god, it’s weird now. A beat as we process Adolf Hitler in Jojo’s bed. It’s wei gogo I'm just tired. I’m going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: sure, I was just keeping it warm for you. Friends do that. He gets out of bed, dressed in full regalia, including th PUFFY-HIPPED PANTS that Generals wear.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey do you think this uniform is slimming? I’m not sure about the hips on the pants. gogo You look great.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF,
dialogues.text: Thank you. Now Jojo let me give you some really good advice. Once you see what's in her mind and where she's trying to get you to go - in your own head, you must go the other way. Don’t let her put you ina brain prison! That, dear Jojo, is one thing that cannot happen to a German! Do not let her boss your German brain around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo stares at him with admiration. Jogo I won't let my brain be bossed around by her, mein Fihrer.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Try not to. It looks like you've got a lot of good information in your book, so I think it’s time to share it with the world, yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo nods. 58. (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitler goes to leave. gogo Um Adolf, do you think I’m... ugly?

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Is that a trick question? (he ponders, then) Is there another word for ugly but not as offensive? gogo I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Well if there was, that’d be you to a tee. Anyway, ugly isn’t a bad thing. Field Marshal Rommel was absolutely hideous but he made up for it with great joke telling abilities. (then) Sweet dreams, little Rabbit. He winks and leaps out the window. Jojo looks in the mirr once more. INT. Jogo’ He scowls at himself and turns out the light. S$ HOUSE - INGA’S ROOM - NIGHT Rosie drinks from a bottle of wine. She swigs

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (nodding) He's different. He suspects something. He thinks Inga’s ghost lives up here. (beat) You remind me of her. You really do. But different of course, you're your own person. I would love to have seen her grow into a woman, but I'll have to watch you instead. some wine.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I don’t know anything about being a woman. Is that what it is, you drink wine?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: sure. (beat) You'll drink; (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: champagne if you’re happy, champagne if you're sad. You'll drive a car and eat cake. Gamble if you want, own diamonds and learn how to fire a gun. You'll go to Morocco, take up lovers and make them suffer, look a tiger in the eye and learn to trust without fear. That’s what it is to be a woman.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Trust without fear. How do you do that, how do you know you can trust someone? Rosie smiles and leans in. She winks

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You trust them. (she kisses Elsa’s head) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: All those other things? Did you do that stuff? You know, go to Morocco, and the rest.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I've never looked a tiger in the eye. and blows out the candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo walks through town towards the Hitler Youth office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo walks in to see FIVE MEN dressed in GERMAN MOUNTAIN - Lederhosen etc. One or two are holding CROOKS. Klenzend is at his desk, explaining something to Finkel.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Finkel. I meant we'd need dogs for when the city is attacked. Not actual... German... Shepherds. (beat) Now get them out of here. (then) And Finkel? I’m sorry I yelled at you, it was an easy mistake to make. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should have been more clear. You're doing a great job. Finkel smiles back at Klenzendorf.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jojo) Hello. How can we help you today, Mr Betzler? What’s up? Walk with me. Jojo walks with Klenzendorf. gogo If someone turned in a Jew would they get a medal or something?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: You still going on about those people? You know we're preparing the city for imminent invasion, right? I’m trying to plan a defense strategy here. We've got American's to the West, Russians to the East.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: My friend once met some Russians and they ate him. gogo I’m really learning a lot about Jews. Did you know they can read each others minds? And when they sleep, they hang from the ceiling like bats.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: And where did you come by this information? Jogo Research. I’m writing a book.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: What‘s it called?

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: “Yoohoo Jew”. It’s an exposé on Jews.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: (giggling) “Yoohoo Jew", oh my god, I love it! you could also call it “Jew, who?” (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: What about “Jews News”?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Oh Jojo, you do have a wonderful imagination! gogo But it’s real, not imagi--

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Oh, of course it’s real! When I was your age I had a “friend” called Conny who used to wet my bed when I was asleep. He got me in so much trouble. Hey, you might like to check out what I’m working on. He holds up a sketch of a man wearing a tasseled uniform, cape, and a helmet adorned with feathers. The drawings ar coloured pencil, some of the pencils still lay about the and as Klenzendorf talks, Jojo secretly pockets a couple. KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) As part of our preparations for the invasion I’m re-designing my uniform. Note, the feathers for aerodynamics, the sparkly colour to dazzle the enemy, the boots are purely decorative. (then) And this is a Gatling gun mounted with a radio which emits annoying music to dishearten the enemy. (suddenly covering the picture with his hand) This is all copyrighted by the way.

dialogues.speaker: FINKEL
dialogues.text: That means you can’t copy it.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Don’t get any ideas kid. The kids tell me that your father’s away fighting. So it appears you are now the man of the house. How's the going? gogo It's ok. Klenzendorf chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What jobs do you have for me today? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I've got one. I won't lie, it’s a bit of a step-down from what you're used to but we need all hands on deck right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: DOOR KNOCKING. A door opens, revealing an OLD WOMAN. REVERSE ANGLE reveals a strange ROBOT CHARACTER made from cardboard and silver paint, standing before her Written in paint along its front we see: HELFT UNS DEUTSCHLAND! (Help us Germany!) WIR BRAUCHEN METALL! (We need Metal!) A little door opens on the robot and we see Jojo's face within. gogo Good morning Frau. Our brave troops and wonderful Fiihrer need your help. I am collecting much needed metal for the war effort which will provide our troops with bullets and airplanes. And guns, tanks, ships, U-boats, bombs. And Iron Crosses.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: What? gogo Do you have anything metal? Nuts, bolts pans, toothpaste tubes... She stares at him a while.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo wanders past torn propaganda posters of Hitler. In h barrow are various items; a piece of RUSTED STEEL, a LEAD PIPE, a few NUTS & BOLTS. Jojo chants as he moves through town. Jogo Metal for Hitler! Nuts and bolts! Pots and pans! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He comes face to face with another METAL COLLECTING ROBOT They stare at each other a moment and go their separate w Just then, Jojo sees a someone familiar. His mother, Rosi Hidden from sight within his Robot costume, he watches as secretly places flyers around the street - in doorways, o tables, in letterboxes. She slips away around a corner Jojo walks to a little table and picks up one of the flye she placed there only seconds earlier. He reads aloud.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Free Germany. Fight the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo unloads his barrow of metal into a large pile of oth donated things.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jojo? He turns to see, Yorki. Jogo Yorki! The two embrace. Jojo steps back to take in his old frien who is now dressed in a soldier’s uniform. A cigarette ha from his mouth but it’s still the same old dorky Yorki.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a soldier now?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: At your service! I even drink schnapps and smoke cigarettes now. Except I don’t light them because they taste like arse. He theatrically “smokes” with his cigarette which isn’t l gogo But you're only eleven.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
