dialogues.text: I know! And look at this uniform, it’s state of the art! Jojo feels the uniform. It is made out of CARDBOARD cover in GREEN MATERIAL. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo It's pretty thin. Is that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: « paper?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Hmm, that’s what I thought at first too. But it’s “paper-like”. It’s the latest material invented by our top scientists. He holds up his arm, the sleeve is way too long. Jogo Well, I’m impressed. You finally made it. Next stop, Hitler’s guard. Jojo shuffles on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: . I caught a Jew. A real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey York.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Wow, good for you! I saw some that they caught hiding in the forest last month. Personally I didn’t see what all the fuss was about. They weren’t at all scary and seemed kind of normal. But don’t tell anyone I said that. (then) Hey what's all that metal stuff? Are you collecting metal stuff? This gun’s metal stuff. Argh, I’m getting distracted, I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs off.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God it’s so hard to run in this thing! INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - DAY Jojo lightly taps on Elsa’s wall, opens the door and hold something out for her: the coloured pencils. gogo You can have them. I don’t care. They’re probably broken. Doesn’t mean anything. That's a good chair. He walks to chair, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Thank you. (CONTINUED)
gogo Yeah well, maybe you can draw some more pictures for my book. Or not.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I could draw you again? gogo No one wants to see pictures of cripples.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're hardly a cripple. Besides, true artists don’t see that stuff. gogo Blind artists you mean. Look, it’s fine, I’1l just accept that I’11 be one of those guys who will never get to kiss a girl. (beat) And I’m not fishing for anything by the way. I feel quite strongly about this

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You will be kissed, Jojo. (beat) Do you want me to kiss you? gogo Ok, two things. Thing number one: it’s illegal for Nazis and Jews to hang out like we do, let alone kiss, so already it’s out of the question. And thing number two: it would just be a sympathy kiss which doesn’t count.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're not a Nazi. JOgO What are you talking about? Of course I am

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Not a real Nazi. Jogo I'm massively into Swastikas so I think that’s a pretty good sign right there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're not a Nazi, Jojo. You're a 10 year old kid who ‘likes’ Swastikas and ‘likes’ dressing up in a funny uniform and wants to be part of a club. But you’re not one of them. Not you. Jogo (rolling his eyes) Okayyy, let’s just agree to disagree, alright? (beat, to himself) Not a Nazi, ha. He picks at an imaginary thing on the wall. Elsa stares a herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What a dirty Jew. Jojo shuffles nervously. He opens the bedroom door. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - LATER Elsa soaks in the tub while Jojo sits outside the door. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - ROSIE’S ROOM - LATER Jojo sits on the bed as Elsa brushes her hair. Yep, she’s beautiful. As he watches her, Jojo shivers a little. He looks down a sees butterflies in his stomach, then looks back at Elsa, worried. Yep, he’s in love. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Downstairs, Elsa looks around, trying out chairs, looking photos, taking in the normality of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: ‘Living room’. Funny name. gogo Stay away from the windows. Suddenly there’s a KNOCK at the door. They freeze. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) She's home. You better hide (calling out) Lost your key, Mama?

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JOJO'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Jojo reaches the door and opens it, revealing FIVE MEN in trench-coats - GESTAPO AGENTS - led by an intense fellow named CAPTAIN DEERTZ.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Captain Herman Deertz of the Falkenheim Gestapo. This is Herr Mueller, Herr Junker, Herr Klum, and Herr Frosch. (then) Heil Hitler. gogo Heil Hitler. (to Mueller) Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: MUELLER
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: (to Junker) Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: JUNKER
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler. Jogo (to Frosch) Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: FROSCH
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: (to Klum) Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: KLUM
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Now, we-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late, my bicycle got a flat tire. I carried it. They are interrupted by Captain Klenzendorf entering, carrying a bicycle, trailed by Finkel.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Captain Klenzendorf? Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler. This is Freddy Finkel. Finkel joins in and the two men Heil Hitler everyone in t room all over again. Finally... KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) So, did I miss anything?

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: No, we were just Heil Hitlering each other and were about to conduct a routine inspection. He nods to the other agents who start snooping around the house, inspecting drawers, cupboards, shelves.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what brings you here, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: We were passing by and wanted to drop off some pamphlets for the boy. He works for us.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: And yourself?

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Oh you know how it is. Routine inspections. We're following up on a few leads that will probably lead to nothing, but it’s all part of the job, isn’t it? Deertz smiles and moves into Jojo’s bedroom. DEERTZ (CONT’D) So, young Johannes, you're helping out at the Hitlerjugend office. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jogo Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Good for you. I wish more of our citizens had your commitment.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Johannes is a fantastic volunteer. He's very imaginative. There is a loud bang upstairs, something being overturned Jojo and the Officer look up.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: What on earth are those oafs up to? Why don’t we go upstairs and see. Yes? He puts an arm around Jojo and they head upstairs. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - UPSTAIRS HALL - CONTINUOUS They stop at Jojo's mother’s room. The officers are looki through her dresser and wardrobe, under the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Do you know where your mother is? gogo No. I think she’s in town.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: And tell me, what has she been up to of late? Does she get to spend much time at home? gogo Well, she is quite busy. Klenzendorf accidentally knocks over a chair. He exhales heavily, clearly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Is she? Hm. Well it’s good to see you are still wearing your Jugend uniform. (beat) But... where is your DJ knife? Jojo looks down to his little sheath, it is still empty. From behind them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's here. They turn to see Elsa standing at the door to Inga’s room She holds the knife in her hand and wears a dress and shi of Inga’s. She looks beautiful and... quite German. Jojo wide-eyed, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: And who might you be?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Who might YOU be? And what are you doing in my house?

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: You live here too? Jogo This... is...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (mocking Jojo) Thisss... isssss... (to Deertz) Speak properly idiot. I’m Inga. His sister. There is an awkward pause. Klenzendorf COUGHS. Jojo tries stall. gogo Heil Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Heil. Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Heil Hitler. The others agents join in and we go through another long round of Heil Hitler salutes, this time with Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had a sister, Johannes.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Well sometimes he'd prefer I was dead. Wouldn't you, little Frankenstein? Klenzendorf looks back and forth between everyone, confus (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nm.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Now, now, no need to attack his physicality. It’s a war wound. And why do you have his knife?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I’m guarding my room because he refuses to stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: What do you have hidden in there?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh you know, girl’s stuff. Deertz goes to enter Inga’s room.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Naturally. He wanders in, inspecting the room. He walks past Elsa’s secret door. Klenzendorf enters, walks past Jojo, eyeing

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: You see we deal with an overwhelming number of reports, denunciations, and general investigations which means we are severely understaffed and overworked Deertz opens the curtains and looks out the window DEERTZ (CONT’D) Now, of course we are indeed interested in problems of crime and anti-party sentiment, but we still have one greater concern; that of the Goldilocksies, running amok, taking advantage of other people in this city. Sneaking around eating people’s food, sleeping in their beds... It’s quite rude (beat, to Elsa) I don’t suppose I could see your papers could 1? Elsa freezes.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmm? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Papers, Ms Betzler. Quickly please, we don't have all day.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Elsa goes to a drawer in Inga’s dresser and opens it. She then tries another drawer and another. Eventually she pul out INGA’S PAPERS. Her hand is beginning to shake, Klenzendorf takes the papers from her and looks at them, and then flicking a look to Elsa. POV of the papers shows Inga when she was sick, GAUNT and PALE; the two girls share a vague resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: How old are you in this photo?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: They're 3 years old, I was 14.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Date of birth? A tense moment as Elsa pauses. Pin drop stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: May 1, 1929. Another long pause. Elsa wipes her sweaty hand on her dre

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: correct. (beat) Thank you Inga. Get a new photo. You look a bit like a ghost in this one. Klenzendorf goes to hand the papers to Deertz who waves t away.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ,
dialogues.text: Wait. What is this... Yoohoo...Jew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo gulps. Deertz spies Jojo’s BOOK sitting on the dress He opens the book and starts flicking through the pages. atmosphere is palpable. Slowly Deertz begins to smile, an then... he giggles. DEERTZ (CONT’D) (stifling laughter) Oh my... Oh my! Tell me, who did this? Was it you, Inga? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s an exposé on Jews, how they look, behave, think. It’ll be a gift to the Fuhrer.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: This is amazing. Guys, look at this. Klenzendorf and the others gather round Deertz as he show them Jojo's fantastical drawings and writings. There are pictures of crazy animals and fairies and magical worlds. DEERTZ (CONT’D) Where did you get all of these ideas? gogo It's an... exposé. For the Fuhrer.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I just said that, Johannes.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: An exposé. Oh, I think he would absolutely adore this. Oh my, this guy is riding a dragon. “Mode of Transport”. (turning a page) Ooh, this is a drawing of their anatomy. Look, this one here shows the inside of their heads. How wonderful. The officers are all giggling now.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I too am quite an accomplished drawer. I actually have slightly better perspective and cross-hatching. Ignoring him, Deertz points at a drawing of David killing Goliath.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Oh look, this guy is killing a giant. oh boy. (beat) And what is this? "Die, Nathan, Die. Ways of killing Nathan.” Oh this is hilarious. Look at this guy Nathan, look at all the ways he’s dying! (beat) Tell me, who is this Nathan? Jojo looks at Elsa sheepishly. She stares at him for a moment, then looks away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: No one. Just a stupid boy. Deertz chuckles. The other officers join in.

dialogues.speaker: DEERTZ
dialogues.text: Well, I must thank you for this. You have really made my day. I do hope you continue with it. And, of course, if you see anything suspicious, give us a ring. Good day. More Heil Hitlers as they leave. Jojo just stands there watching.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: We're scaling down our operations at the Youth Office, Jojo, so your participation is no longer required. Stay home, kid. Look after your family. Look after this knife. Jojo nods. Klenzendorf leaves. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - ELSA’S HIDEOUT - MOMENTS LATER Jojo finds Elsa huddled in the corner clutching Inga’s papers. gogo Elsa, you fooled them.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: May 7. gogo What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She was born May 7, not the first. Jojo takes the papers and reads. The DOB read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : May 7, 1928. Jogo He was helping us.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: They’1l be back. They’1l find out she’s dead. Then I’1l be dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo Nobody really knows Inga died. You can be her Elsa. It’s okay, 1/11 tell mama everything when she gets home. I’1l tell her I know you, that we're friends. Elsa retreats away from Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Jew and Nazi are not friends. This hits Jojo. Elsa buries her head into her hands and begins to cry. She goes into her hideout. Jojo leaves. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER Jojo sits at the kitchen table twiddling his thumbs while Adolf, wearing oven gloves, stirs a pot on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: So that was pretty much a bust. I can’t believe they fell for her disguise. Mind explaining that? gogo She doesn’t seem like a bad person.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: (immature) Poor Jojo, he’s a widdle bit tired and confused and the only thing he can cook is invisible soup. He is suddenly serious, elements of the real Hitler start building as he gives an impassioned speech.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am beginning to question your loyalty to myself and the party. You say you are a patriot but where is the evidence? The German soldier was born out of necessity, Germany depends on the passion of these young men, passion and a readiness to fall for the fatherland. Their resurrection will be seen in the rise of the German folk, despite the futile efforts of Allied war profiteers who send their ill-prepared armies clumsily into the lair of the wolf. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And only those zealous men who stand steadfast in the face of the enemy will be remembered, their names etched into German memory forever. But it is up to you to decide if you want to be remembered, or forgotten like a grain of sand, disappearing without trace into the desert of insignificance (beat) To put it plainly - get your shit together and sort out your priorities. You're ten, Jojo. Start acting like it He walks out, dramatically knocking over a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo wheels his barrow down an alley which opens up into town square. He rests a moment and sees a BUTTERFLY movin past him along a row of flowers. Jojo smiles at this, takes interest and follows the butterfly, crouching low to the ground, he follows the butterfly deeper into the square. Low to the ground, he admires the butterfly which has now come to a stop upon another flower. The butterfly flutters away. Jojo notices the light on th ground is disturbed by shadows moving back and forth. He stands. Right in front of him are a pair of shoes, dangling. He i the middle of bodies hanging from the GALLOWS. He backs a from the body and into another pair of feet. We recognize these shoes. They are his mother’s He stumbles back, shaking, tears welling. After a moment he moves back towards his mother. He tries reach her hand. It is too high. He looks back down toward her shoes and notices her lace is untied. He tries to tie them but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun sets Jojo remains in the park, sitting beneath bodies. Quiet. still.  7. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - ELSA’S HIDEOUT - NIGHT Elsa sits in Inga’s room, reading by candlelight. Jojo en the room. Elsa looks down to see he’s holding his DJ knif tears streaming down his face. He walks up to Elsa and stabs her just below the collarbo He's too weak to drive it all the way in but she does lit to stop him. Slowly she raises her hand, places it over his and pulls the bloody blade. Blood seeps down her chest. She nods at him. Jojo struggles against her until he collapses to the floor. He lies on his back. Elsa kneels next to him. They look at each other. EXT. JOJO’S HOUSE - ROOFTOP - NIGHT Jojo and Elsa sit on the ROOF while distant bombing light the horizon. gogo Did you know?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She didn’t tell me much, only that she worked with friends and that your father was somehow involved from afar. gogo No, he’s fighting in the war.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She said he’ll return as soon as the war is over. She didn’t want to tell you anything for obvious reasons. gogo (nodding, tearing up) Because I’m a Nazi. Because she hated me. I’m the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She didn’t want you to know anything that could get you in trouble. She wanted to protect you - more than anything, more than me. You were the most important thing to her. gogo But they found out what she was doing in the end. They got her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She died trying to save lives. That is the greatest honor any person can achieve. gogo But now I have nothing. No one. Elsa puts an arm around his shoulder. More bombs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: The last time I saw my parents was at the station. They were put on a train. I ran. Slowly found my way back to the city. A friend of my father’s hid me. Then another friend, then friends of friends... till your mother took me in. (then) So far I am still here. But my parents went to a place you don’t come back from. Jogo What is the first thing you'll do when you're free?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Dance. MUSIC CUE: ‘EVERYBODY'S GOTTA LIVE’ BY LOVE

dialogues.speaker: JOJO AND ELSA
dialogues.text: = Jojo walks past a group of women and other locals as th clear rubble and debris from their houses. - Jojo barters with a local PEASANT for some OLD VEGETABL - Elsa draws pictures of her surroundings; the view, the objects in the room, Jojo. - Jojo reads Elsa a “Nathan letter”. - Various shots of the kids living together. Dinners. Reading. Talking. Being. = Jojo is out in the snow collecting sticks. He sees a RABBIT. = Jojo is eating a water soup while Adolf eats a roast UNICORN HEAD. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: = Jojo's bedroom; Jojo pins another one of Elsa's drawing the wall. There are now as many of them as his pictures o Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo heads down a street and finds a group of civilian lo being given weapons and instructions on how to use them. There are a couple of women and young boys among them, al looking very out of their element and bewildered. We hear an explosion a few blocks away. Civilians run the opposite way towards safety. Jojo moves towards the chaos He rounds a corner and sees Yorki, his uniform in tatters running on the other side of the street with another kid. They're carrying a ROCKET LAUNCHER. Jogo Yorki! Yorki sees Jojo, waves, trips and falls. The Rocket Launc hits the ground and fires -— sending a missile across the where it blows up a shop. GLASS and DEBRIS shower the str

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Scheisse! I’m so clumsy. (beat) Jojo! I've missed you. I’m sorry about your mama. I cried for ages when I heard what happened. They hug. Jogo Yorki, what's going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: The Russians Jojo, they’re coming. And the Americans from the other way. And England and China and Africa and India and Australia. The whole world is coming! Jogo How are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Terribly! Our only friends are the Japanese and just between you and me, they don’t look very Aryan. Germany's completely run out of money. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YORKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean look at this uniform, it really Is made of paper. They just glued cotton on top of it. He turns around and we see the back of his jacket has bee completely burned off. YORKI (CONT’D) I gotta get this ammo to the gunners. You can help. Yorki puts the ammo in Jojo’s barrow and they head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids make their way down a street, the fire-fight in distance getting closer. It’s loud and chaotic. Other soldiers run around, old people and kids mainly gogo Hey, remember that Jew I told you about?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. You caught one. gogo I still have her. She’s basically my girlfriend now.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Good for you Jojo! A girlfriend! gogo But she’s, y'know... Jewish.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: There are bigger things to worry about than Jews, Jojo. There’s Russians somewhere out there. They’re worse than anyone. I heard they eat babies and have sex with dogs. I mean, that’s bad, right? Jogo Sex with dogs?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Englishmen do it too. We have to stop them before they eat us and screw all our dogs. It’s crazy. And now Hitler’s gone we're really on our own. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jogo What?

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: You didn’t hear? He’s dead. He gave up and blew his brains out. gogo No. That's impossibl

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Blew them out. His brains. Turns out he was hiding a lot of stuff from us. Doing some really bad things behind everyone's backs. I’m not sure we chose the right side. Jojo and Yorki round a corner. As they approach another MACHINE GUN POST we see an ENEMY TANK in the distance tra on the fortification. It fires and there’s a huge explosion. The boys drop everything and RUN OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighting is more intense and we see more KIDS and OLD PEOPLE, dressed in stupid paper uniforms, huddled in corn trying to figure out what to do. Some are crying. The boys round a corner and find Fraulein Rahm preparing battle. She’s sticking a GRENADE into the back pocket of CLONE.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Ok, little clone! Go find a Russian or an American and give them a big hug! She pulls the PIN on the grenade and sends the kid out in the battle.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Y'know, I’m not sure we chose the right side. I’m beginning to wonder if we might be the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Yorki! Here, you've been promoted. Take a gun and go kill anyone who looks different to us! Go! Go! Go! She shoves Yorki out into battle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRAULEIN RAHM (CONT’D) Jojo! Here, put on a jacket so you know what side you’re on! She hands Jojo a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Russians are over there! The Americans are that way! We must kill everything we see! For HITLER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a massive MACHINE GUN and runs out into the fra FRAULEIN RABM (CONT’D) Die, DEVIL SCUM!!! Suddenly there’s a huge explosion and the street is engul in smoke and dust - Jojo and Yorki are separated.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: gogo Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Yorki has disappeared. More shots and yelling. Dazed and disoriented, Jojo makes his way through the haz smoke and debris, passing the last defenders of the town women, children, the elderly - all desperately trying to off a much stronger enemy, and failing. KLENZENDORF runs past. We see that he is wearing his unif but it has been altered according to his earlier drawing. has SPARKLY SEQUINS on the collar, TASSELS down the sleev FINKEL is with him, dressed in a similar outfit. There is electric energy between them. Klenzendorf sees Jojo, give triumphant smile, and runs off. Jojo follow suit and finds shelter behind a wall. He watc as German soldiers retreat from the enemy. Some are gunne down, others hide behind vehicles and continue to engage. There are fires burning throughout and the scene echoes t crazed frenzy of the book burning bonfire from earlier. O this time everyone is confused, freaked out and crying. Jojo ducks into a doorway and hides in a hole. FADE OUT.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo walks through the ruins of his town. He sees a soldi playing A PIANO in a bombed out house. German POWs are being led away at gunpoint by AMERICAN SOLDIERS. Just then Jojo hears a whimper and looks down to see a du hand reaching out from some rubble. Jojo lifts an old door up and finds Fraulein Rahm. She's dying.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN RAHM
dialogues.text: Oh, Heil Hitler, Jojo. Can you lift this building up so I can get out? She does indeed have a building on top of her. FRAULEIN RAHM (CONT’D) fell Hitler 1/11 be waiting for him in Heaven where everyone is perfect. She dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music blares, it’s an anthem of some sort. Jojo stares wi eyed as AMERICAN TROOPS officially enter the city in a convoy. Some people are waving, happy. Others are crying. Officer Deertz is also there, along with and a couple of Gestapo agents being taken away. A WOMAN holding her child waves at the passing ALLIED CON

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: The war is over! America is here! Everyone is free! We’re all going to get Levi jeans! America! Americaaaaa! Tanks pass by. Adolf sits perched on a local STATUE. He's disheveled and looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo walks down a small street. We see more discarded pho of Hitler and burned Nazi banners.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: German! Wehrmacht! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then a Russian Soldier grabs Jojo by the scruff of t neck and shoves him into a group of German POW’s being marched at gun point down the street. Among the group we see Christoph, one the arsehole kids f the Hitler Youth Camp. He’s crying. We also find CAPTAIN KLENZENDORF, his revamped uniform in tatters. Jojo makes his way to Klenzendorf. Jogo Captain K! What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Hysteria my friend. We’ve come to the end. Jogo Fraulein Rahm is dead. A building fell on her.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: (wiping away a tear) And my dear Finkel is gone too. I was very fond of him. They're led into a private COURTYARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're jostled about, pushed and shoved into groups.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Move! You, move there!

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Hey Jojo. I'm sorry about Rosie. She was a good person. An actual good person And I’ve been meaning to tell you, I think your book is really great. I’m sorry for laughing at it. There’s some very important stuff in there. I wish it was around when all this started. (beat) You're a good kid. Now go home and look after that sister of yours. He clocks a RUSSIAN SOLDIER approaching. Klenzendorf smil at him for a moment before ripping off Jojo’s jacket and shoving him to the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KLENZENDORF (CONT’D) Get away Jew! The soldier levels his gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What's going on? You are a Jew?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: Yes. He’s scum.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Shut up, Nazi. (to Jojo) You know this Nazi? gogo (pointing at Klenzendorf) He helped us

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: He is Nazi. (to Klenzendor£) You know the boy? A brief moment as Klenzendorf stares at Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: KLENZENDORF
dialogues.text: I don’t know this dirty Jew. Jogo What?

dialogues.speaker: KLENZ ENDORF
dialogues.text: Ugly Jew brat! The soldier smashes Klenzendorf square in the face with t butt of his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth Nazi. (to Jojo) Jew, get out of here. Go home. gogo No! He and Klenzendorf exchange one more look before the sold grabs Jojo and pushes him out onto the street. The large gates close behind him. Jojo gets to his feet and dusts himself off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MACHINE GUN FIRE rings out from inside the courtyard. Jojo runs and, turning a corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +.bumps straight into Yorki. He’s covered in dirt and ash and has lost his uniform. He now wears only underpants an undershirt.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Jojo! gogo Yorki! I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: No, it seems I can never die. Jogo I don’t understand what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: YORKI
dialogues.text: Me neither. Nothing makes sense. It’s definitely not a good time to be a Nazi. (beat) I’m gonna go home and see my mother. I need a cuddle. Hey. So now the war's over at least your girlfriend will be free. She can leave now. Jojo steps back realizing Elsa may leave.

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: I have to go. He wonders off pondering and confused. EXT. JOJO’s HOUSE - DAY Jojo slowly wanders up to his house, pauses a moment outs the front door, and walks inside. INT. JOJO’S HOUSE - INGA’S BEDROOM - EVENING Jojo runs into Inga’s room. It’s empty. He stands next to the door of her hideout. INTERCUT between Inge’s room and Elsa’s hideout. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gogo Hi, I’m home.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What's going on out there? Jogo Out where?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Outside, dummy. (beat) Jojo, what’s going on? Is it safe to come out? Jojo thinks for a moment. Conflicted, he makes his decisi

dialogues.speaker: JOIO
dialogues.text: No. You can’t leave.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Who won? (silence) Jojo. Who won the war? She shuffles nervously. gogo Germany. (beat) Germany won the war. Elsa looks around at her prison.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I thought I could leave. Jojo stands in the room. Alone. He moves to the dresser and looks at a family photo, then the picture of his sister. His book - Yoohoo Jew - lies on the dresser nearby. He op it and starts leafing through the pages, taking in everyt he and Elsa discussed and worked on together. He stops at a picture of he and his mother riding their bicycles. He turns the page and sees another picture, this time it’ a RABBIT IN A CAGE. Outside the cage is a little boy. Jojo takes a moment, then rips out a blank piece of paper (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits next to the door to Elsa’s hideout. He knocks. Beat. gogo Hi. I have another letter. (beat) Dear Elsa, I know it’s hard for you at the moment. I know you feel like giving up. But you have to carry on. Your friend Jojo and I have devised a plan to help you escape. So please listen to him. He will help you get out of there. Then you can come to Paris and live with me and we can eat snails and frogs and other disgusting things that humans aren’t supposed to eat. (beat) And don’t worry about Jojo, he’ll be ok when you leave. (beat) See you in Paris. (then) Nathan. Elsa’s door opens.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: He's dead. Jogo What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Nathan. He died last year. Tuberculosis. Jojo holds up his fake letter. She smiles. gogo Oh, that’s weird. But then who wrote this?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jojo. You've been so good to me. gogo Elsa, me and fake Nathan have found a way for you to escape Nazi Germany. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: How do I know I can trust you? gogo Well, the thing is... I love you. I know you think of me as a younger brother and you're too old anyway but-— (beat) Man, it’s hot in here.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I love you too, Jojo. gogo As a younger brother.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: As a younger brother. gogo Well then, maybe you could trust a younger brother? She smiles. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Get your things together. We're leaving. INT. JOJO HOUSE - JOJO’S ROOM - DAY Jojo puts on his jacket and looks at himself in the mirro different boy than we met at the beginning of the movie

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jojo Betzler. 10 and a half years old. Today... just do what you can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to walk out of his room, BUT ADOLF steps into the doorway, blocking his path. He has a gaping wound on the side of his head where he shot himsel

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF,
dialogues.text: Where in the shit do you think you’re going? gogo out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Oh no you're not. You’re staying right here and you're going to tell me what the hell's going on. Be honest. gogo I can’t hang around with you anymore. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: I said be honest. (beat) You betrayed me, traitor. gogo You betrayed everyone! I believed in you!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: But you stopped believing! And now you're best friends with that thing in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: attic. gogo That thing is a girl.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: You're in love with her aren't you? gogo Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Admit it gogo I just said yes!

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: I knew it! Well she’s too old for you and you're ugly. Jojo stares at Adolf.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. I’m sad things didn’t work out with us, however I’m still kind of proud of you. Massively disappointed, but also proud. I like to think of you as my strange, wayward, disappointing, ugly son. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adolf hand: g1. (5)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gogo I already have a dad and now the war is finished he’s coming home.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: But you need me! I’m all you've got! You'll never make it out there. You're a scared little ugly rabbit. You'll die without me! s Jojo a SWASTIKA ARMBAND.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me. I’m going to give you one last chance to make things right. You're going to put this on and forget about that disgusting Jewy cow up there, and you're going to come back to me where you belong. Got it? Jojo screws up the armband and throws it on the ground. A buckles in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heyyy... hey, how about you Heil me, yeah? Come on, for old times sake? (beat) Heil me, little man. Jogo No...

dialogues.speaker: ADOLF
dialogues.text: Come on, you know you want to. Just a little Heil. Just a little bittle Heil for your old friend? gogo No. Fuck off Hitler. And with that, Jojo kicks Adolf as hard as he can in the balls. Adolf screams as he goes FLYING THROUGH THE WINDOW out into OBLIVION. Hitler is INT. Jogo’ Jojo leads no more.

dialogues.speaker: S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Elsa by the hand down the hall. They reach the front door and Jojo notices something. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOO
dialogues.text: Wait. He bends down and ties Elsa’s shoelaces. She watches as h does this, a small smile creeping across her face. Jojo finishes and stands.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) You ready?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jojo unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jojo. Is it dangerous out there? Jojo winks a PERFECT WINK. Jogo Extremely. He opens the door. Light fills the entrance to the house. They step outside. EXT. JOJO’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Jojo and Elsa stand on the front steps of the house. Elsa looks at Jojo and then back out to the street. A car full of celebrating soldiers drives past - an Ameri flag sticking out the back. They take in the view and Jojo does a small fist pump. gogo Yes... we made it. Elsa turns to Jojo and stares at him. She slaps Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yep. Probably deserved that. (then) So what do we do now? Elsa shrugs and stands there. And then, ever so subtly, a very slowly, she begins to sway... rhythmically. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jojo follows suit and moves his shoulders back and forth. MUSIC CUE: ‘HELDEN’ BY DAVID BOWIE Jojo and Elsa slowly begin to DANCE - not for anyone else just for themselves and each other.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Let everything happen to you Beauty and terror Just keep going No feeling is final. “Rainer Maria Rilke END.
